ğŸƒ 3-1 Bookaween Story Book â€“ Time to Make Your Page!Â  (TOMORROW)

Hi 3-1!

Tomorrow I need your page for our Bookaween storybook for Halloween. Use the guide we went over today to help you.

Here is what to do:

Make your own page for your character.
Think about the other characters too so your page matches the story.
Write your part of the story clearly on your page so everyone can read it.
Use lots of color to make your page fun and Halloween-y!
I have attached the story to this announcement. Please feel free to change things and add your own touches. I want you to make it your own, but keep the story similar so the whole story makes sense.

We will have 12 pages completed byÂ Thursday. After that, we can make the cover (page 1) and the back page together.

Canâ€™t wait to see your amazing pages! ğŸ–ï¸âœ¨

Math
The math test is TOMORROW! The assessment pages in the book are very similar to what will be on the test.Â  Read over the assessment pages tonight and be ready for the test tomorrow.

Please have your child practice a little Khan Academy math each night
Â atÂ https://www.khanacademy.org/join/VK6QDS9EÂ to help strengthen their skills.

Language Arts

Complete pages 58-59 in the Grammar workshop book. (TOMORROW)

ğŸŒ World Heritage Day â€“ Ireland

Theme: Animals in Folk Culture and Mythology Around the World

Our class will represent Ireland for World Heritage Day! Students will work in groups to make a poster and a fun interactive activity to help visitors learn about Irish culture, traditions, and mythology.

Students will meet during advisory, some class free time, and also prepare a little at home with their group members.

ğŸ‡®ğŸ‡ª Our Groups

ğŸ€ Irish Language and Culture Team â€“ Ian C, Alex, Noah

ğŸ° Irish Symbols and Landmarks Team â€“ Woojoo, Jason, Siwoo

ğŸµ Irish Dance and Music Team â€“ Stella, Jiwoo, Yujoo

ğŸ‰ Irish Myths, Animals and Legends Team â€“ Jenny, Jey, Ian Sa

ğŸ’¡ Ideas for Each Group
ğŸ€ Language and Culture

Teach greetings like Hello (Dia dhuit) and Thank you (Go raibh maith agat)
Show counting 1â€“10 in Irish
Make a small word-matching or speaking game

ğŸ° Symbols and Landmarks

Show Irish symbols such as the shamrock, harp, and tricolor flag
Add famous landmarks like the Giantâ€™s Causeway or Cliffs of Moher
Make origami shamrocks or a matching game

ğŸµ Dance and Music

Show Irish step dancing or traditional instruments (harp, fiddle, tin whistle)
Let visitors try a rhythm or dance step
Create a small rhythm challenge or quiz

ğŸ‰ Myths, Animals and Legends

Tell Irish stories like The Children of Lir or The Salmon of Knowledge
Show drawings of the animals and where the stories happened
Act out part of a story or make a story-matching game

ğŸ– All Groups Should

Create a poster with visuals and short explanations
Include something interactive for visiting students
Help create our class Blooket quiz about Ireland (each group adds 2â€“3 questions)

ğŸ¥” Food for World Heritage Day â€“ November 20

We will also share traditional Irish food on the day.

Parents are kindly invited to send a small dish or sample food for the class to share.

Some simple Irish-style foods could include:

Mashed potatoes or shepherdâ€™s pie
Sausages or Irish stew
Scones, soda bread, or buttered bread
Shortbread or biscuits

Thank you for helping make World Heritage Day fun and meaningful for everyone! ğŸ‡®ğŸ‡ª
